title: Be part of CSA! - Community Supported Agriculture

tasks.task: Understand the concept of Community Supported Agriculture (CSA)
subtasks: Recognize the mutual commitment between farmers and consumers
Identify the local dimension of CSA movements
Understand solidarity in farmer-consumer relationships
Note the direct connection and trust between producers and consumers
Know the environmental benefits of CSA
Recognize the contribution of CSAs to local economies
Comprehend the benefits for small-scale farmers
Identify opportunities for consumer participation in CSA

tasks.task: Explore the history and growth of the CSA movement
subtasks: Acknowledge the development of CSA in the latter part of the 20th century
Note the current participation numbers in Europe
Recognize the continuous growth of CSA initiatives

tasks.task: Analyze the advantages of engaging in CSA
subtasks: Understand the benefits of fresh, locally produced food
Appreciate the responsible and sustainable farming practices
Consider the potential reduction in food miles and packaging
Recognize the support for biodiversity conservation
Note the higher income and fairer returns for farmers
Value the strengthened community ties
Consider the ability to address consumers' needs directly
Acknowledge the support and trust in collaborative farming
Note the provided website for more information (www.urgency.net)
Recognize linkable logos for national networks
